titleStmt.title: John C. McCormack et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1851

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Garrard County Ky April 30th 1864
To the Hon Thos E Bramlette
Sir

The undersigned citizens of Justices District No 1 in Garrard County would respectfully represent that owing to the removal from our Dist. of E. M. Seavell Esq we are in great need of a Justice of the peace and ask your honor. to appoint and commission, James H Henry as such. He has here to fore served the Dist. in that capacity in a faithful and impartial manner, and at the solicitation of the undersigned & others of his neighbors has consinted to serve again if appointed.

Respectfully &c &c
J. H. Kennedy Jr
Jno L. Slavin
C Shumate
R. N. Moran
Wm Eads
J W Slavin
S. Carpenter
W. S. Walker
H. T. Turrill
G. Denny
J. D. Henderson
Lytle Roston
Jno. C. McCormack
R G Woods
B. Ramsey
Jas M. Reid
F. A. Leakey
Jas G Slavin
A. F. Denny
Wm Lawson
H Best
S. C. Henderson
W. R. Robinson
J. S. Robinson
A Pollard

Lancaster May 31st 1864
Hon T E Bramlette
Gov. Ky
Sir
The undersigned officials of the County respectfully recommend the within to your favorable consideration

very respectfully
N Sandifer P J G C C
Jas A Anderson Co Atto
W H Whewitt Co Clk

Garrard Co
Justice Peace
apptd
2nd June/64
